/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe5bb0f57cff3e299f360052ba50f1ea0fff046df2be070b6943e0e3c3fdad8a9","urls":["bzzr://cf2d583b8dce38d0617fdcd65f2fd9f126fe17b7f683b5a515ea9d2762d8b062"]}},"version":1}

params._isBuyer: If the caller is to be the buyer, else they will be the seller
params._marketId: Contract for this market (see PriceFeeds.sol markets)

params._isBuyer: If the caller is to be the buyer, else they will be the seller
params._marketId: Contract for this market (see Feeds.sol markets)

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

createByUpgrade().notice: Upgrade a CFD at a different set of contracts to this set of contracts. The old CFD itself will invoke this function to do the upgrade.

createContract(bytes32,uint256,uint256,b.notice: Create a new ContractForDifference instance given DAI.

createContractWithETH(bytes32,uint256,ui.notice: Create a new ContractForDifference instance given ETH.     * Sent ETH is traded for DAI on the fly and the resulting amount of DAI is the contract collateral. So callers should calculate how much DAI collateral they want ahead of time and send the appropriate amount of ETH to match.
